user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
This has been my favorite blush on me for years. I’ve used many different brands, colors, and formulas. Plum gorgeous was the color that always looked best against my skin so I always went back to it. I recently ordered it, after not using it for years, and I have been so disappointed. The blush is so hard that I have to scrape it loose with a metal file then try to pick it up with a blush brush. It is CLEARLY very old & outdated. Very disappointing...I plan on returning it. Guess I will have to find my new holy grail blush color.

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: It's so disappointing to find this is NOT the plum blush Clinique originally had, which was truly a soft lilac/lavender color. This "plum" is actually brown - not at all what I wanted. The original "plum" was truly GORGEOUS; this is NOT!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Time for Some New Formulas and Colors
review_content: Seriously, Clinique needs to come up with new blush formulations and colors. These blushes have been around for as long as I can remember, and believe me, that's a long time! They have so many state of the art foundations, and then they have these stale old blushes. Clinique, new blushes and new colors please!!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: The color doesn’t seem to go on quite as strong as what it looks like in the compact, but it could just be that it blends well. It’s subtle - not a major rosy cheeks sort of thing. I would say 4 1/2 stars.

user_specs: ['Age 13-17', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: Almost no pigment shows up, even when using your finger. The color looks georgeous in the pan, but it's hard to actually get any product onto a brush.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Green']
review_content: Goes on very lightly and gives a desired effect. Not cakey and looks wonderful all year! I have received a ton of compliments about it

I got this blush in my first makeup kit and at that time I knew nothing about blushes. This blush hardly has any color payoff. I have to keep applying over and over for ten or twenty times to have the color show up on my skin. And since it appears light, I never tried to see whether it lasted. New clover is a nice shade though. However what you want from a blush isn't to make you look like having no blush on and this is what the product does.

Plum gorgeous is my favorite blush of all time. It always looks good no matter what.

I like the color of this blush but the brush sheds more than my dog. It leaves broken black hairs all over your face that are hard to get off. Back to drug store blush for me. It's just as good if not better.

I had high hopes for this blush after one of my favorite You Tubers raved about plum gorgeous. Although after using this it is absolutely horrible. The color is chalky and there is absolutely no cool payoff. I dig my brush into it and there's literally nothing. When I look at the pan you can't even tell I've tried using it. This is one purchase I highly regret. Especially for the price.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content: I really love this blush . I ordered this blush because of the color . It different then what i have in my collection ( the plum shade ) I am extremely fair skinned and this is such a pretty shade on my skin . The packaging is so pretty and sturdy . I have nothing bad to say
I was really excited about the color of this blush, but it's so chalky there's hardly any color payoff. I had to sit there digging my brush into the pan to get any color at all and Im very fair.

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Skin Type Dry', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: I just bought the Pink Blush today and I loved it, but my 19 year old daughter tried it and wow...it looked great on her! She has a pink undertone like her mother and the blush looked like she just came in from the cold. So sheer and natural looking.

I have a love/hate relationship w Clinique blushes in this packaging. I love the colors, they are beautiful, new clover is my all time favorite blush but geeze the packaging is annoying, I don't like the strip. These blushes would be so much more user friendly if the blush was in a circular or square form not a rectangle. Also there is nothing soft pressed about these blushes, I have Owned a few of these blushes and repurchased couple they are all HARD AS A ROCK and it never fails I always throw them out after a while bc the blush is hard and you have to scrape it w your brush and if course the deliverance of the blush is maddening.

I got this in Pink Blush in a set and I also had New Clover. They are both pretty colors. I have light skin and both colors were just right. The powder glides on so smoothly and the color stays on all day with no touch ups. This is the only blush I will ever buy.

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content: This is my favorite blush. Very natural looking unlike most blushes I have tried.

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Skin Type Oily', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: I didn't expect this blush to perform so well. I got it in a set and I can honestly say it's one of the best blushes I've ever used. It lasts all day long even when my foundation has started to wear off and the color is really natural looking and looks great. Overall it's just a really great blush and I would definitely recommend it.

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Eye Color Blue']
review_content: I have been using this blush for almost 10 years. It is my absolute favorite. It goes on smooths, lasts long, and doesn't clog my pores. LOVE IT!

I received a tiny brush with a sample disk of Plum Gorgeous from my grandmother when I was just a little girl. I played around with it and kept it in storage until just a couple weeks ago when I brought it back out. The color was still true, no caking, no damage. I fell in love. I bought the full size and use it just about every day. It seems like this will last me forever! It looks great on my pale skin. Just dark enough to be noticed, but still subtle and natural.

I used to use Mac blush, but I received this in a gift set so I gave it a try. Well, I haven't looked back since. This lasts twice as long, a little goes a long way, and the colors are beautiful and natural looking. My favorite shade is new clover. I have light brown hair, fair skin, and green eyes and it is just right on me. It's the perfect pink shade!
This is my favorite blush of all time. It gives you the most natural color and is compatable withso many skin tones.

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Eye Color Blue']
review_content: This is one of the only powder blushes that doesn't get brighter on my skin. Looks natural and just gives my olive, combination, post-menopausal skin a calm glow. I also have Chestnut and I like it to, but I think pinks are better suited to my skin tone. Very happy with this color and product.

user_specs: ['Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content: I love the plum gorgeous shade

I have been using Clinique products now for about 1 month. I am getting older and finding that my facial needs are changing. I got a little make over at a clinique counter and was very happy with this product. I have no break outs and is a very smooth product.
I really love the color of the blush, but I feel like my blush brush barely picks up any of the blush. I rubbed my finger over the blush 5 or 6 times and there was not much blush on my finger.

I had purchased this blush in plum gorgeous about 6 years ago, and lost it within the last few years. I was hesitant about spending more money on blush so I tried several cheaper blushes. I should have just bought this again right away, because nothing else looked more natural and blended so easily! It's not harsh and really gives your face a gentle healthy glow, I would recommend having a consultant choose the right color for you, that really makes all the difference. This will be my go to blush for as long as they continue to make it!

I got the pink blush and I've used it up entirely. I'm definitely coming back for more! It goes on lightly so you can really easily build up the color

I have this product in Pink Blush, and I absolutely love it. I'm very pale and it's difficult to find a blush that isn't too bright or clownish on me, but this shade looks very subtle and natural. If you want a more dramatic looking blush look elsewhere, but for a soft everyday look it can't be beat!
Got this color based on other reviews posted by Asians. I have medium Asian skin. It brightens my face.

this is 1 of my favorite blushes!i have mine in new clover and its sucha a nice wearable color you can wear everyday!i really recommend this blush my mom even loves it.she has hers in mocha pink ...it is worth the money!

I used to use this sometimes, before Nars Orgasm replaced it. It did have very pretty natural glow, but it really doesn't blend well. Everybody else seems to really like it, though, so maybe it's just me.
I use the pink colors and it works so well on my light skin tone in summer and winter. I use it every day and it has lasted me months so far. Even though it is a powder it doesn't look cakey at all.
Pink Blush has a little more of a plum tone on me. It ends up looking very natural on my fair skin. Pretty, sheer enough to layer over a cream blush, and it has decent staying power.
This color is perfect!!! It's so hard to find a blusher for fair skin that's not peachy or too warm. It's the perfect cool pink that compliments my skin tone.

I have fair, oily skin that is prone to acne. I tend to stick with powder blushes for this reason. I purchased this in the Pink Blush so I wouldn't overwhelm my face with too much color. This blush goes on easy, but I found I had to use quite a bit of color to see something on my face. By the afternoon the color is mostly gone, so I would need to reapply. I will say it does not make my skin break out, which is a good thing. Also, the blush lasts a long time.

I struggle with finding the right color of blush, and while it isn't a wow factor, goes on beautifully and naturally. Can use this color anywhere for color and it's natural
sheer and fresh-color has always been a favorite for me-like cooler tones in both summer and winter
I love this blush - have been using it for years. It has a nice consistency and does not look caked on. Clinique has a great shade for every skin tone.

I got this blush in "New Clover" and I feel like there are two batches. I think I got the bad batch because the blush is sooooo hardly pressed I CAN'T get any blush onto my brush! Not even when I rub my finger on the blush is there ANY pigment on my finger! I tried scratching it and yes, the color does come out and it pretty okay, but really, do I have to "scratch" it everytime I want to use it? Total turn off.

review_title: This is a really awesome product for anyone!
review_content: i really love blushes so of course i had to try this one and i love it!
I got this blush when I first started using makeup a while ago. It's not that great. There isn't much pigmentation at all, and it doesn't really show up on my face. Kind of disappointing.
Nice color. Very pretty when applied but wears off very quickly.
good color not too pink, not too brown. like it a little more in summer with a slight tan.
This shade of blush was recomended for light skin. I have a very hard time making this work for me and I am very light skinned.
powder much lighter than appears, difficult to pull off compact and onto brush. will be looking for a different brand.

i love Clinique products and this is one of my staples of theirs. i think this blush is waaay under-hyped. i haven't tried the cult-fave Nars Orgasm but i won't be pulled away from this sure-deliverer. i have used this soft-pressed powder blusher in Chestnut for 8 years, since i was 18 years old and first really starting to put makeup on. alot of other blushes at that age would make me irritated or breakout, but this one was great. also, the chestnut hue is beautiful.. perfect natural glow for a medium beige-toned asian woman like me. when i put it on, it really brightens up my whole face and i look radiant. most days, all i need is this and some mascara to brighten up my face right away.

I had to wait a few months to order this in Plum Gorgeous but it was worth the wait. This shade is not too dark and it doesn't change color as the day goes on. It provides good coverage without looking harsh. A couple of sweeps is good for day time, a few more sweeps for night time. This blusher is much better than the one in the silver case.
Pros: Nice blush for on-stage performances... Nice compact mirror Cons: The brush bristles fall out The brush is scratchy Too bright for everyday usage.

I've gone through 2 of these. I wear this blush almost everyday & it takes a long time to finish this product, so $19 is definitely worth it. The color is intense enough that 2 strokes on each cheek is enough to last the entire day. It's not drying on the skin (I have combination skin & my cheeks are dry). It may look really purple on the palette, but when applied it looks more of a healthy blush on my Asian skin.

I have this in the travel set, but it's pretty good (:

I have been using this blush ( plum georgeous color) for 10 years. It is absolutely GREAT!!! It goes on so smooth, stays put all day long and the color is great for all seasons!!!!!!!!!!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!

I received this blush from my step mother in law in "New Clover" color. It went on so natural on my cheek. When I put it on, my cheek will look like it has a natural flush on it. Though it is so natural, the color does compliment and brighten my face. I have the Asian skin color (kind of yellow + very light tan). Before, I thought that coral color would be good on my face, but it just blended into my skin totally. Then, I thought that peachy pink color like NARs Orgasm will be good as many people recommend it, but it did make my skin look darker! The glitter on it also made me look like having a lot of make up on, and unnatural (regardless of what other people said) I did not like this, and I asked my step mother in law to try on her cheek color (She has very fair skin like other European) And wow!! the color matches my skin unbelievably!! It so nice and creamy on my cheek. So, she gave it to me as she thought that it matches me so well. I will continue using this color "New Clover" for sure. Maybe you can get this color at the counter as Sephora does not have it. P.S. I hope this is useful to some Asian girls with very light tan like me. The glister on cheek products does not give you that GLOW as you think. The glow must come from inside of you and your skin, not by glister! It makes your make up look thick. Believe me. But, I think it could be good if you wear it to a party at night.

review_title: been wearing this for ev er
review_content: awesome shades. i wear it, my mom wears it, good for all ages.
I've had my "mocha pink" forever now, and I still love it. I'm more into cream blushes now, but this is a very nice powder blush.
This is a pretty decent blush. It goes on matte and matched my natural blush pretty well. However, I found it didn't last all day which I never had that problem with any other blush before.
I love love love this product. I would not think of leaving my home without it!
Goes on evenly, but is a bit brighter on the skin than looks in the compact. Like the fact that it's matte. Lasts forever.
Clinique is always reliable. I love this blush-it looks soooo natural.

I'm absolutely in Love with the color "New Clover" it's a great Blush for the spring/summer. For me it's similar to another fav & fab Blush -Tarte "Flush". In the winter months I really like "Plum Gorgeous"... but with a bronzer, tan, or a fake bake, this color is beautiful year round. (Plus I don't need to use as much) When using "New Clover" I always use too much (wait!) It's on purpose, then add plenty of mineral powder over top. This has helped my blusher's last longer on many occasion- Since the mineral powder disapates more quickly than the Blush does~ By the end of a Long work day...honestly ~ I might need to re-apply once. Unless I'm going out, and that another reason to own at least 2-4 good blushers. (Although you see I'm fair to light skinned,w/Blue eyes. my natural hair color is light Blonde...."BUT!!" I've found the only other color that looks natural on me is Black ~ So for now I'm raven haired) Thank for leaving the names of your Clinique blush colors, and what they look like on you! So many reviewers forget we depend on that! Plus... I Love rating reviews ~ Oh, no...I will not rate against someone. But since Sephora has given us a Forum for this purpose- 'To help others" I rate those who take the time to tell us about their Sephora purchases, the color name, what it looks like on them... and tips for application.

New Clover has been one of my go-to blushes for about 4 years. Despite buying new blushes and trying out the latest colors, I always come back to this one. It gives my fair skin a very natural pink glow. I love it!
Not to impress with this product expected more because of the name. It does not last long and I really do not like the blush that is included.

Its a very natural looking blush. Good for beginners because of its sheer coverage. It's definitely buildable but on my darker skin it takes multiple swipes. Very blendable but not as long lasting as I would like. Not sure how long it stays but upon application in the morning I'd say it's typically gone by the afternoon.
I wear this stuff every single day! It gives my cheeks a little sparkle and great color!
I've tried different shades of this but none look very natural. It also doesn't last very long once applied.
I really liked this blush. It goes on smoothly and is a great color because it is subtle.

Plum gorgeous is a natural looking shade on my olive skin. The color is amazing and I love it. The brush that comes with the blush is horrible, however. Make sure that you have a good blush brush if you buy this.
I like how this blush goes on light on your skin.

I've used this blush for three plus years, and I have to say that it's the best out there with the exception of Nars. I have it in new clover which is slightly pinker/brighter than the swatch appears. I use this blush everyday, it gives great natural tickle me pink coverage. It's great for a flushed look, if you want to give yur cheeks somecolor without looking like someone slapped your cheeks. Also I usually stray away from powders, because I have dry skin but even in winter it's fine and the powder is very light on my skin, I love it!

I got this blush in New Clover (a matte color) as a gift with purchase from a department store. I'm quite fair (the lightest color when buying Clinique's Superfit foundation) with either yellow or olive undertones (am always told different things by makeup consultants), and this looks very natural on me. The powder is pigmented, and the color is easy to build up to your desired level of intensity. I'm giving this four stars because I don't think it has as much staying power as some other blushes out there, and you may have to reapply once or twice during the day. Also, I prefer blushes in round rather than rectangular packaging as I find them easier to use with my blush brush.
…read more

I've used this blush for over 20 years and it's still one of the best there is. The colors stay true and last all day. The powder is soft and it adheres well to your skin, does not fly away or look dry.
I really like their blush colors, it stays on hour after hour, no need to reapply, does not make you cheeks break out, good all around.
i started wearing this because it was what my mother wore when i was young, but the colors are a bit drab, and it really doesn't last very long. It's very sheer, and not in a good way.
This blusher goes on nicely, and has a shade that will work for just about any skintone. Looks range from natural to flashy. Overall a nice product.

I keep trying other blushes and coming back to this one. The color works well day or night, and works well on my fair skin whether my hair is red, blonde, or brown. My other favorite blush is Lancome, however this Clinique blush has a lot more staying power. Only drawback is sometimes it looks a little bright after it's been on for a while.

This is a very good blush! The colours are pretty & last a while on. I find the peachier colours tend to look even less pink once they are on the skin for about an hour. The powder is light & doesn't cause me to break out.

This blush would make a better eyeshadow. The brush is so small, I put some blush on the brush and apply it to the crease above my eyelids. It gives my eyes subtle definition and looks very pretty. I have it in Totally Tawny, which also makes a good contour on light-skin girls like me.
This blush is ok, nothing great. Goes on smooth.

review_title: Natural-looking, lots of color choices, bad brush
review_content:
I consider blush to be the most essential cosmetic item for my skin and wear this blush every day. It's very natural looking and you can layer it on top of itself for more intense color in the evening. Clinique Soft-Pressed Powder Blusher has a lot of color choices -- it's the only product where I've found more than one color that I can wear with my very fair skin without looking like a kewpie doll. HATE the brush that comes with it -- it's not good for anything and the fibers start to come out very quickly.
…read more
This blush is great! It provides a natural glow, blends easily, and is lightweight. I have tired the Plum, Mocha Pink, and Pink and loved them all!
The colors ( I tried 3 before giving up and moving on) do not look natural on my skin tone. Might be better on lighter complexions.
I've been using this blush for years - it gives me healthy, natural-looking color in my cheeks and never looks overdone. Love the color.
This blush is really good for sensitive skin. It is really light and gives a natural gentle color to cheeks. It also lasts for most of the day.
have used this brand for a couple of years. have tried others but these shades are most natural and blend nicely

i really like this blush for everyday use. i first tried it because i got a sample of it in Mocha Pink and it is a very natural, pretty, gives a glow type of blush. i like that it does not have any glitter in it cuz glitter just annoys me sometimes! for sure its a must have for anyone who likes to have a good makeup collection such as me
This blush goes on sheer and builds to just enough natural color. The range of colors is amazing, and no one I know has had trouble finding a color that looks perfect on them.

I love this blush! I've been using it for aaaagggeeesss. The colour is delicate. It has great staying power. It is layerable for deeper looks. It's versatile and flattering. SO pretty! Natural looking. Just the right blend of flat and sparkle so it's a good day time wear that goes into evening wear. I don't use the brush it comes with, i use a larger nicer blush brush with an angle to it. But i keep the brush in the compact for travelling purposes.
…read more

This is such a smooth and flawless product! It goes on light but added layers don't "gum up" on your face at all. I have several different shades in my range and they all work for my skin tone. Long-lasting too! Very natural looking color if applied correctly.

review_title: Great Colors But a Little Too Sheer
review_content: I love this blush. I have it in Fig. They only thing that bothers me is the fact that it is a little to sheer. I find myself having to put it on a few times before it shows up on my face. I also wish the package was a bigger blush and no brush. The brush is so small it is not very usable.
This is one of the best blushes I have ever tried! It does go on fairly sheer but blends easily. The colors are great and long-wearing.
Goes with every thing. Perfect shade for pinks, reds. browns, blues.

The shades are all great ( I own 3 of them), but I have to say that the brush that comes with this is horrible. It makes the blush glide on my face in a very streaky manner and it doesn't look natural, so I use another brush to put it on, but once you have the right tools, you can definitely make these blushes versatile on your skin. I brush on one coat during the day, and more for night time.
if not applied correctly this blush can look to harsh. it took me a little while to get the feel of it. make sure to use a bigger brush to avoid a blush line across your face, or at least blend well.
this is a classic, in fig, for medium/olive skin. so simple and pretty
too pressed may be, not my product. I think its good for light skin.

Great blush. Goes on sheer, but it buildable. Gives a nice natural color and there are no glitter chunks like a lot of blushes today. Doesn't irritate my sensitive skin either. I wish it was sold without the brush - i never use it.
This is hands-down one of the best powder blushes I've ever used. Even the darker shades give my very fair skin a natural flush; & has a little bit of shimmer that gives a natural glow.
